original_title: Bronx: Gun Hill Road (East) - Holland Avenue
text:
E. Gunhill Road, at and adjoining the S. E. corner of Holland Avenue, showing the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception and the Monastery for Capuchin Fathers. The view is across Italian gardens from Cruger Avenue and Magenta Street.

View 1: May 24, 1928
View 2: May 25, 1928
View 3: Spring, 1938

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Bronx: Gun Hill Road (East) - Holland Avenue
text:
(1)
East Gunhill Road, at the S. E. corner of Holland Ave., showing the Church of the Immaculate Conception (R.C.). The view is in an easterly direction.
May 24, 1928
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the church as seen from the N. E. corner of White Plains Road, where excavation work is in progress.
May 25, 1928
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An additional view of the church, viewed from White Plains Road, across a vegetable garden and improvised shacks.
May 29, 1928
P. L. Sperr

original_title: Bronx: Gun Hill Road (East) - Holland Avenue
text:
739-743 East Gunhill Road, at the N.W. corner of Holland Ave., showing the Little Flower Day Nursery.

May 25, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Tilden Street; at, adjoining and east (left to right) of the N.E. corner of Holland Ave., as seen across East Gunhill Road, showing at the corner, the Immaculate Conception Hill Community House. The two houses adjoining it bear Nos. 709 and 711.

June 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Bronx: Gun Hill Road (East) - Holland Avenue
text:
E. Gunhill Road, adjoining the S.E. corner of Holland Avenue, showing the Capuchin Fathers' Monastery.

May 11, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.
